result.execSummary:
The defendant Alex J. Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent. Not to possess controlled substances w/o valid prescription and must notify agent w/in 48 hours if one is received.  Absolute Sobriety from alcohol and controlled substances.  Random UAs.

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alex J. Brown

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Alex J. Brown in court with attorney John H. Bradley.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State states recs.  Atty Bradley agrees and Guilty plea entered.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on plea/accepts/finds guilty.  Atty Bradley requests expunction be part of the judgment.  State objects as that was not part of the CSR.  Atty Bradley will proceed w/o the expungment agreement.  DE makes statement on his own behalf.  Court sentences.

Ct 1:  Guilty - amended to Misd. THC
Probation for 12 months
Conditions of probation:
$563.25 costs/fine/surcharges to be paid per agent during term of probation
AODA/Treatment/Counseling and any other evaluations per agent
Absolute sobriety from alcohol and controlled substances unless he has a valid prescription and if he gets one he must notify his agent w/in 2 working days
Random UA's
Ct 2:  Dismissed/read-in
Return date on October 3, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
May not possess any controlled substances or drug paraphernalia
Return date on September 4, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Alex J. Brown in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  Requests Preliminary hearing;  Waives right to an attorney for today's hearing.  State advises an offer is available.  Time limits waived.  $1100.00 SIGNATURE bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Booking today & may not possess any controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.  Return date scheduled for September 4, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
